intro: Oenanthe stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water dropwort, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Oenanthe stenoloba is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
